conversation.content: Um, hi, uh... I just spent, er, twenty minutes in your... system? And I, um, I help people with this stuff.
Oh no, I know exactly what you mean—our IVR is brutal. Let me just pull up your account, what's your name?
Sarah Chen. Um, it's just... I literally, uh, coach people on phone interviews and, er... couldn't find billing.
Sarah, I think I've got you here, account SCH-4429-NK. And um, honestly? I get lost in our own system sometimes, so, uh, you're definitely not alone there.
Wait, really? You work there and...
Oh absolutely, um, like just last week I was trying to, uh, help my mom navigate it from the outside and I, er, I gave up and just handled it internally.
Okay but, um, how do I, uh... know you're not just... saying that to, er, make me feel better?
Fair question! So your last call was seventeen days ago, reference number REF-8827-QP, about updating payment method, right?
That's... um, yeah. Wow. Okay so, uh, you can actually, er... see all that?
Everything, yeah. So um, what couldn't you find today? I can, uh, probably shortcut this whole thing for you.
Billing. Just... wanted to check a charge.
Got it, so um, I'm seeing a charge from October 15th, transaction TXN-993847-BC for $47.99, and then, uh, another one yesterday for the same amount.
Um, wait, yesterday? That's, uh... that shouldn't... I mean, er, is that real?
Looking closer here—yeah, duplicate charge, system glitch. I'm reversing it now, confirmation RVS-2847-MM should hit your account in 2-3 days.
You can just... do that? Right now?
I mean, um, technically I'm supposed to, uh, file a dispute form first but, er, it's obviously our mistake, so...
But won't you, um, get in... I mean, uh, if someone checks or, er...
Honestly? My supervisor probably would've done the same thing. Case number CSE-7736-PL for your records though, just in case.
This is, um... not what I expected. Like, uh, at all. Usually it's just, er... "sorry, nothing we can do."
Yeah, I, um, I wish I could fix the phone system too but, uh, that one's above my pay grade unfortunately. Anything else though?

scenario: career counselor, ironic that she can't navigate this company's terrible phone system
